issue.title: Angular 14.0+ calendar- $event.item is missing in the contextMenuItem
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

We are using the angular-calender (angular-calendar": "^0.28.24) in Angular -10 for scheduling functionality.

We have a **context menu**, when I click the option in the **Add Schedule** option will display as shown below

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117059735/198939467-e54476fe-e54c-403c-8226-6b8cd330e125.png)

**Code:**
`<ng-template *ngIf="name=='schedule'" contextMenuItem (execute)="addEvent($event,$event.item)"> Add Schedule </ng-template>`

Here, **$event.item** will give the cell information of where I did right-click and click the **Add Schedule**

```
{
    "date": "2022-10-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "displayDate": "2022-10-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "isStart": true,
    "id": 1,
    "personcompanyid": "D063521359",
    "name": "WILLIAM FITZSIMMONS",
    "bkcolor": "#b7fd67"
}
```
Everything is working fine in Angular 10 as expected. Now, we are upgrading the entire project to angular 14. Here, we are using angular-calendar": "^0.30.1. Here , **$event.item returns undefined**. Can you please help me on this one?

<!-- Please describe the bug you're experiencing here. -->
<!-- Please search existing issues first before opening a new one -->

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**


<!-- A link to a minimally working stackblitz that reproduces the issue (you can fork a starter from any of the demos by hitting the "Edit in Stackblitz" button) -->

https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/#/context-menu

**Screenshots**

From https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/#/context-menu, **the $event.item is missing.** 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117059735/198939674-e29f08b7-da9c-4b1e-a712-5079b1b95ac8.png)

**Versions**

<!-- Please complete the following information -->

- `@angular/core`:^14.2.1
- `angular-calendar`: ^0.30.1
- Browser name and version: Chrome and Version 107.0.5304.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)

I am using mwl-calendar-month-view, and selecting days in a simple modal. I am trying to override the opacity in the view of the next month. So for example, I could be showing the last two weeks of October and first week of November, and the first week of November will have opacity already set. I would like to override this opacity and make the first week of November the same opacity as the last two weeks of October. In terms of css, the opacity is getting applied no matter what I do, and the only thing  can do is make it more opaque, which is the opposite of what I want.. Is there any way to override this opacity, or am I stuck with the settings as they are?

issue.title: week-view calendar - use specific timezone
issue.body:
Is it possible to use the week-view calendar completely independently of the client's time zone, that is, to use a specific time zone so that the start/end dayHour (00-23) refer to the local time of that defined time zone, not to the client's zone? 
Also I expect to get events mapped properly according to the specific time zone. 

FYI:  I am using angular-calendar-0.28.28

issue.title: Calendar is slow loading with 30k events
issue.body:
<!---

FAQ (please read!):

Need an example of how to do something? Check the demo page, it probably has you covered: https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/demos/

Need a full list of all API options? Check the docs for each component:
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarMonthViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarWeekViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarDayViewComponent.html

Please note that issues that ignore this template will be closed without notice!

-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**

I am trying to load 30,000 events and it is taking around 2 minutes to load them. I am using basic calendar settings

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I cannot find a switch for lazy loading/fetching and hoping there is someway around this. What I would like to see here is that when someone first loads the calendar that it only loads the data for that view (in my case month view) and then only load the data for each navigation click (changing the month, day, week, etc).

**Describe your use case for implementing this feature**

The use case here is pretty simple, it takes a long time to load the events. once the calendar loads it's fast and as expected but waiting 2 minutes for it to load is not really an option for my client.

**Additional context**

None at this time.

issue.body:
I know you need to be a sponsor to post but i was one a while back and for a long while and never really asked questions here so I hoping i still can as i think the quest is simple enough.

I am using a much older version and plan to upgrade soon but wanted to get this working on this build as upgrading angular is going to take me a while. If that is what i have to do then so be it but hoping i'm just missing something here.

Angular: 8.0.0
Angular Calendar Build: 0.27.18

All I really want to know is if there is a flag to turn on/off for lazy loading? I have almost 30,000 events loading on this calendar and its takes a significant amount of time (almost 2 minutes) to load the calendar. I only want it to load events when the day/month/week views are changed and have the initial view just load the current data for whatever view it starts on (in my case it always starts on month view).

Any help would be appreciated. 

Thanks

issue.title: jalali calendar support
issue.body:
Jalali calendar calculation is different and this is not implemented.
This library needs a capability for adapter class injection to set [Jalali Moment](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jalali-moment)

For example : https://gist.github.com/moein459/768318ccb67a0daaf8234d742753cb46

issue.title: Add meta properties changes detection in the refresh process
issue.body:
<!---

FAQ (please read!):

Need an example of how to do something? Check the demo page, it probably has you covered: https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/demos/

Need a full list of all API options? Check the docs for each component:

https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarWeekViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarDayViewComponent.html

Please note that issues that ignore this template will be closed without notice!

-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**

The calendar doesn't refresh when changing some meta properties after calling this.refresh.next().

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Trigger the function refreshBody of calendar when at least 1 meta property has changed.

**Describe your use case for implementing this feature**

I'm using a CustomEventTitleFormatter to add an image directly for each event I create. I pass the image URL in the meta properties and when the URL changes (and by triggering this.refresh.next()), I would like the calendar being updated too. My case only concern body because I'm only using CustomEventTitleFormatter.

**Additional context**

I think changes detection is happening here so change.events should includes meta properties changes too.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18117568/184049507-bcf37a7c-8c32-4c13-b719-e9346a656f0d.png)

issue.title: Can't import angular-calendar SASS files in an Angular project.
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Can't import library SASS files in an Angular project. Getting the following error:
```
SassError: Can't find stylesheet to import.
   ╷
12 │ @import "~angular-calendar/scss/angular-calendar";
   │         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   ╵
  src/styles.scss 12:9  root stylesheet
```

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**

Create an empty Angular project that imports the SASS file in the app `styles.scss` by using:
```
@import "~angular-calendar/scss/angular-calendar";
```

**Versions**

- `@angular/core`: ^14.0.0
- `angular-calendar`: ^0.30.0

Here, **$event.item** will give the cell information of where I did right-click and click the **Add Schedule**

```
{
    "date": "2022-10-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "displayDate": "2022-10-31T05:30:00.000Z",

issue.body:
<!---

FAQ (please read!):

Need an example of how to do something? Check the demo page, it probably has you covered: https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/demos/

-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**

I am trying to load 30,000 events and it is taking around 2 minutes to load them. I am using basic calendar settings

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I cannot find a switch for lazy loading/fetching and hoping there is someway around this. What I would like to see here is that when someone first loads the calendar that it only loads the data for that view (in my case month view) and then only load the data for each navigation click (changing the month, day, week, etc).

**Describe your use case for implementing this feature**

The use case here is pretty simple, it takes a long time to load the events. once the calendar loads it's fast and as expected but waiting 2 minutes for it to load is not really an option for my client.

**Additional context**

None at this time.

Angular: 8.0.0
Angular Calendar Build: 0.27.18

All I really want to know is if there is a flag to turn on/off for lazy loading? I have almost 30,000 events loading on this calendar and its takes a significant amount of time (almost 2 minutes) to load the calendar. I only want it to load events when the day/month/week views are changed and have the initial view just load the current data for whatever view it starts on (in my case it always starts on month view).

Any help would be appreciated. 

Thanks

issue.title: jalali calendar support
issue.body:
Jalali calendar calculation is different and this is not implemented.
This library needs a capability for adapter class injection to set [Jalali Moment](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jalali-moment)

For example : https://gist.github.com/moein459/768318ccb67a0daaf8234d742753cb46

issue.title: Add meta properties changes detection in the refresh process
issue.body:
<!---

FAQ (please read!):

Need an example of how to do something? Check the demo page, it probably has you covered: https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/demos/

Need a full list of all API options? Check the docs for each component:
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarMonthViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarWeekViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarDayViewComponent.html

Please note that issues that ignore this template will be closed without notice!

-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**

The calendar doesn't refresh when changing some meta properties after calling this.refresh.next().

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Trigger the function refreshBody of calendar when at least 1 meta property has changed.

**Describe your use case for implementing this feature**

I'm using a CustomEventTitleFormatter to add an image directly for each event I create. I pass the image URL in the meta properties and when the URL changes (and by triggering this.refresh.next()), I would like the calendar being updated too. My case only concern body because I'm only using CustomEventTitleFormatter.

**Additional context**

I think changes detection is happening here so change.events should includes meta properties changes too.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18117568/184049507-bcf37a7c-8c32-4c13-b719-e9346a656f0d.png)

issue.title: Can't import angular-calendar SASS files in an Angular project.
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Can't import library SASS files in an Angular project. Getting the following error:
```
SassError: Can't find stylesheet to import.
   ╷
12 │ @import "~angular-calendar/scss/angular-calendar";
   │         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   ╵
  src/styles.scss 12:9  root stylesheet
```

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**

Create an empty Angular project that imports the SASS file in the app `styles.scss` by using:
```
@import "~angular-calendar/scss/angular-calendar";
```

**Versions**

- `@angular/core`: ^14.0.0
- `angular-calendar`: ^0.30.0

issue.title: Angular 14.0+ calendar- $event.item is missing in the contextMenuItem
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

We are using the angular-calender (angular-calendar": "^0.28.24) in Angular -10 for scheduling functionality.

We have a **context menu**, when I click the option in the **Add Schedule** option will display as shown below

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117059735/198939467-e54476fe-e54c-403c-8226-6b8cd330e125.png)

**Code:**
`<ng-template *ngIf="name=='schedule'" contextMenuItem (execute)="addEvent($event,$event.item)"> Add Schedule </ng-template>`

Here, **$event.item** will give the cell information of where I did right-click and click the **Add Schedule**

```
{
    "date": "2022-10-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "displayDate": "2022-10-31T05:30:00.000Z",
    "isStart": true,
    "id": 1,
    "personcompanyid": "D063521359",
    "name": "WILLIAM FITZSIMMONS",
    "bkcolor": "#b7fd67"
}
```
Everything is working fine in Angular 10 as expected. Now, we are upgrading the entire project to angular 14. Here, we are using angular-calendar": "^0.30.1. Here , **$event.item returns undefined**. Can you please help me on this one?

<!-- Please describe the bug you're experiencing here. -->
<!-- Please search existing issues first before opening a new one -->

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**


<!-- A link to a minimally working stackblitz that reproduces the issue (you can fork a starter from any of the demos by hitting the "Edit in Stackblitz" button) -->

https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/#/context-menu

**Screenshots**

From https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/#/context-menu, **the $event.item is missing.** 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117059735/198939674-e29f08b7-da9c-4b1e-a712-5079b1b95ac8.png)

**Versions**

<!-- Please complete the following information -->

- `@angular/core`:^14.2.1
- `angular-calendar`: ^0.30.1
- Browser name and version: Chrome and Version 107.0.5304.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)

issue.title: Calendar is slow loading with 30k events
issue.body:
<!---

FAQ (please read!):

Need an example of how to do something? Check the demo page, it probably has you covered: https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/demos/

Need a full list of all API options? Check the docs for each component:
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarMonthViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarWeekViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarDayViewComponent.html

Please note that issues that ignore this template will be closed without notice!

-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**

I am trying to load 30,000 events and it is taking around 2 minutes to load them. I am using basic calendar settings

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I cannot find a switch for lazy loading/fetching and hoping there is someway around this. What I would like to see here is that when someone first loads the calendar that it only loads the data for that view (in my case month view) and then only load the data for each navigation click (changing the month, day, week, etc).

**Describe your use case for implementing this feature**

The use case here is pretty simple, it takes a long time to load the events. once the calendar loads it's fast and as expected but waiting 2 minutes for it to load is not really an option for my client.

**Additional context**

None at this time.

issue.title: How does one lazy load or enable lazyFetching with this calendar?
issue.body:
I know you need to be a sponsor to post but i was one a while back and for a long while and never really asked questions here so I hoping i still can as i think the quest is simple enough.

I am using a much older version and plan to upgrade soon but wanted to get this working on this build as upgrading angular is going to take me a while. If that is what i have to do then so be it but hoping i'm just missing something here.

Angular: 8.0.0
Angular Calendar Build: 0.27.18

All I really want to know is if there is a flag to turn on/off for lazy loading? I have almost 30,000 events loading on this calendar and its takes a significant amount of time (almost 2 minutes) to load the calendar. I only want it to load events when the day/month/week views are changed and have the initial view just load the current data for whatever view it starts on (in my case it always starts on month view).

Any help would be appreciated. 

Thanks

issue.title: jalali calendar support
issue.body:
Jalali calendar calculation is different and this is not implemented.
This library needs a capability for adapter class injection to set [Jalali Moment](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jalali-moment)

For example : https://gist.github.com/moein459/768318ccb67a0daaf8234d742753cb46

issue.title: Add meta properties changes detection in the refresh process
issue.body:
<!---

FAQ (please read!):

Need an example of how to do something? Check the demo page, it probably has you covered: https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/demos/

Need a full list of all API options? Check the docs for each component:
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarMonthViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarWeekViewComponent.html
https://mattlewis92.github.io/angular-calendar/docs/components/CalendarDayViewComponent.html

Please note that issues that ignore this template will be closed without notice!

-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe**

The calendar doesn't refresh when changing some meta properties after calling this.refresh.next().

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Trigger the function refreshBody of calendar when at least 1 meta property has changed.

**Describe your use case for implementing this feature**

I'm using a CustomEventTitleFormatter to add an image directly for each event I create. I pass the image URL in the meta properties and when the URL changes (and by triggering this.refresh.next()), I would like the calendar being updated too. My case only concern body because I'm only using CustomEventTitleFormatter.

**Additional context**

I think changes detection is happening here so change.events should includes meta properties changes too.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18117568/184049507-bcf37a7c-8c32-4c13-b719-e9346a656f0d.png)

issue.title: Can't import angular-calendar SASS files in an Angular project.
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Can't import library SASS files in an Angular project. Getting the following error:
```
SassError: Can't find stylesheet to import.
   ╷
12 │ @import "~angular-calendar/scss/angular-calendar";
   │         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   ╵
  src/styles.scss 12:9  root stylesheet
```

**Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions**

Create an empty Angular project that imports the SASS file in the app `styles.scss` by using:
```
@import "~angular-calendar/scss/angular-calendar";
```

**Versions**

- `@angular/core`: ^14.0.0
- `angular-calendar`: ^0.30.0
